byline.contributor: Thibault Bluy contributed reporting from Ouagadougou, and Ian Austen from Ottawa..

abstract: Armed assailants carry out 15-hour seige of popular area of Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, leaving 28 people dead; officials blame affiliate of Al Qaeda for attack, leaving nation to grapple with reality that Islamic extremism it has evaded for years has reached across its borders.

headline.print_headline: Deadly Standoff Leaves Burkina Faso Stunned
headline.main: Deadly Standoff Leaves Burkina Faso Stunned

snippet: Gunfire raged through the night as armed forces from Burkina Faso, assisted by French and American forces, stormed the popular downtown area where attackers had set off explosives.
lead_paragraph: Gunfire raged through the night as armed forces from Burkina Faso, assisted by French and American forces, stormed the popular downtown area where attackers had set off explosives.
